title: Sabarimala case: 9-judge SC bench to hear pleas on discrimination against women at religious places
description: A nine-judge Supreme Court bench will hear pleas concerning women's religious entry rights, including the Sabarimala Temple case, starting April 7, 2026. The court will examine the intersection of essential religious practices, equality, and constitutional morality across various faiths. This hearing follows a 2018 ruling that permitted women of all ages into the Sabarimala temple.

Why school bus commutes in the UAE are raising health and learning concerns
description: The UAE has introduced new limits for school bus journeys, capping travel at 45 minutes for young children and 60 minutes for older students. This move addresses concerns about long commutes impacting children's health, sleep and academic focus. Global research highlights physical discomfort, air pollution exposure and mental stress as key issues linked to extended travel times.

title: I am an SC woman. Will my caste change if I marry a general category person? HC explains
description: The Allahabad High Court has ruled that caste is determined by birth and does not change with conversion or marriage. This landmark decision came while dismissing an appeal challenging a lower court's order to try nine individuals under the SC/ST Act. The court emphasized that inter-caste marriage does not alter a person's caste identity, reinforcing protections against atrocities.

title: Watch: Pandya lashes out at Kuldeep during India's win over Pakistan

Ishan Kishan’s 77 powered India to 175/7, while Pakistan collapsed early despite Usman Khan’s 44.

Chopra, a keynote speaker, spoke about her formative years in the US and her journey bridging Bollywood and Hollywood, inspiring students with her experiences.

description: Noida villages are in turmoil as unfounded rumors about child abductions circulate, causing a wave of panic. Families are withdrawing their children from school and many are leaving their jobs, overwhelmed by fear despite police stating there's no proof of such threats. This frenzy, intensified by viral social media posts, recalls troubling instances of mob violence sparked by false information.

title: Samajwadi Party leader dies after 1,000kg lighting pole crashes on his SUV in UP
description: A Samajwadi Party leader, Lal Bahadur Yadav, was killed when a 1,000-kg high mast lighting pole collapsed onto his moving car in Pratapgarh. The incident occurred during installation near Babuganj market, with eyewitnesses stating the pole lost balance suddenly. Police are investigating the alleged negligence and safety concerns.

Jasprit Bumrah and Hardik Pandya's early wickets, followed by effective spin bowling, sealed the comprehensive win.

title: 'Delhi declaration' may be adopted at AI summit in Delhi
description: India has launched its first comprehensive AI governance guidelines, opting for a flexible, principle-based approach to foster innovation while managing risks.  These seven 'sutras' emphasize trust, people-first development, fairness, and accountability.  The framework relies on existing laws and proposes new institutions to oversee AI, aiming to position India as a leader in responsible AI development.

description: Research shows the buy-and-hold returns strategy on investments are significantly higher than the actual returns of a market timer. This difference is referred to as behaviour gap

title: Why two is better than one in a home loan
description: If the primary applicant has a weak credit profile, adding a co-applicant with a strong credit profile increases the chances of approval of the loan application

title: Cows can use tools, and one Austrian cow has now shown it clearly
description: A cow named Veronika has been documented using a brush as a tool, choosing different ends and techniques for different body parts. The finding challenges long-held assumptions about cattle cognition and suggests our environments and biases, rather than animals, set the limits of what we notice

title: Demystifying home loan insurance for borrowers
description: Since the insurance is bundled with the loan, customers, who are typically presented with a single option, rarely compare alternatives or question whether the product is suited to their needs

title: Understanding what CPR is and how you might be able to save a life!
description: Mastering cardiopulmonary resuscitation, or CPR, empowers anyone to potentially save a life during cardiac arrest, a leading cause of death worldwide…

title: Charlie Kirk Honored by TPUSA Amid Backlash Over Bad Bunny Super Bowl Show
description: Super Bowl LX became a cultural flashpoint as Bad Bunny’s historic halftime show unfolded alongside a TPUSA alternative event honoring the late Charlie Kirk. Supporters paid tribute to Kirk with dedicated performances, while Bad Bunny delivered a cinematic, message driven production featuring over 300 dancers and a real wedding. Praise and criticism followed, including a sharp reaction from President Trump. The night highlighted a divided audience and two competing visions sharing the same stage.

title: Team Canada rules out Brad Marchand, Josh Morrissey vs Switzerland
description: Team Canada faces Switzerland at the 2026 Winter Olympics without key players Josh Morrissey and Brad Marchand. Morrissey is sidelined with an undisclosed injury sustained against Czechia, while Marchand's absence remains unexplained. Seth Jarvis is set to make his Olympic debut, replacing Morrissey on the third line, with Travis Sanheim also stepping into the lineup.

title: Fact check: Viral crash video falsely linked to Jutta Leerdam wardrobe malfunction
description: The viral video claiming to show Jutta Leerdam crashing and tearing her suit at the Winter Olympics is false. The clip actually shows Suzanne Schulting at a December 2025 World Cup race in Norway, as reported by NU.nl. Meanwhile, Leerdam won gold at Milano Cortina 2026, with Jake Paul celebrating emotionally.
